title: All you need to know about writing a mountable Rails Gem with rspec
description:
This article briefly talks about how to write a mountable rails gem and what are the practices that I followed
First things first Rails generates nice boilerplate for your gem which is sometimes hard to get it right in the first go. Use this simple command and you are good to go
$ rails plugin new <gem-name> --mountable --skip-test-unit --dummy-path=spec/dummy The --mountable option helps in creating a mountable gem. The --skip-test-unit skips generation of test templates in test folder The --dummy-path specifies where the dummy test application {which we will be using for testing} should be generated.
